definition: to congregate/to assemble/to mass/to gather together/to amass/to polymerize
to gather together/to collect/to approach/to draw near to/to add/to sum up/to comb (hair)

sentences.english: Others were gathering a second expedition to the tide pools.
sentences.chinese: 另一些人聚攏在一起，準備再來一次潮汐池遠征。

sentences.english: Then the swish of leaves colliding as my rake herded them together.
sentences.chinese: 然後，用耙子把葉子聚攏到一起時發出了葉子碰撞聲。

sentences.english: The children rabbited together again when the teacher left the classroom.
sentences.chinese: 老師離開教室後孩子們又聚攏在一起。

sentences.english: The well-born young Athenians who gathered around Socrates.
sentences.chinese: 那些聚攏在蘇格拉底身邊的上等雅典年輕人。

sentences.english: Is still this life me walk too hurried, forget to gather together float on the scattered oath in wind.
sentences.chinese: 還是今生我走得太匆忙，忘了聚攏飄散在風中的誓言。

sentences.english: And the lips, of course, come in.
sentences.chinese: 另外嘴脣當然要向內聚攏。

sentences.english: The peasants crowded around him and dropped pennies into his cup.
sentences.chinese: 農民們聚攏在他的周圍，將錢扔進罐中。

sentences.english: We are all bunched together in the crowded elevator.
sentences.chinese: 在擁擠的電梯裏我們聚攏在一起。

sentences.english: And they gathered them together upon heaps : and the land stank.
sentences.chinese: 衆人把青蛙聚攏成堆，遍地就都腥臭。

sentences.english: The forces of globalization have drawn the world together as never before.
sentences.chinese: 全球化的力量將世界前所未有地聚攏在一起。

sentences.english: The observer is put together by thought as the past.
sentences.chinese: 觀察者被思維聚攏在一起，作爲過去。

sentences.english: The entire clan crowds around them in a circle.
sentences.chinese: 整個部族的人都聚攏過來，把他們倆圍成一圈。

sentences.english: THE speed with which clouds of economic gloom and even despair have gathered over the global economy has been startling everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 憂傷乃至絕望的經濟陰雲聚攏，其速度令人喫驚。

sentences.english: Subsequently, many people wanted to come, surrounded him to the front of the store to discuss that.
sentences.chinese: 隨後，不少人聚攏過來，簇擁着他到店門口要討說法。

definition: to twitch/to throb/a spasm/to extract and use
surface of the body/periphery of the body/body thermometer/(literary) a person's appearance
(of a guitar, kite etc) to have a string break/(of a tradition etc) to be discontinued/(telephone or Internet connection) disconnected/cut off
